contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=October 2009}} {{Infobox settlement |name = {{raise|0.2em|Jing'an}} |native_name = {{lower|0.1em|{{nobold|{{lang|zh|静安}}}}}} |other_name = Zinoe |official_name = {{longitem|style=font-size:105%;|{{nobold|{{lang|zh-cn|静安区}}}}}} |settlement_type = [[District (China)|District]] |image_skyline = Nanjing Road Changde Road.jpg |image_size = 250px |image_map = Shanghai administrative Jing'an.svg |map_caption = Location within Shanghai |area_total_km2 = 7.62 |population = Nanjing West Road, Changde Road intersection |population_as_of = 2003 |population_density_km2 = auto |population_total = 320000 |blank1_info = 200040 |blank1_name = Postal Code |blank_info = 021 |blank_name = Area Code |website = http://www.jingan.gov.cn/ }} '''Jing'an District''' ({{zh|s=静安区|t=靜安區}}, [[Shanghainese]]: zin<sup>2</sup>oe<sup>1</sup> chiu<sup>1</sup>, [[Mandarin Chinese|Mandarin]] [[pinyin]]: ''Jìng'ān Qū'') is one of the central districts of [[Shanghai]]. It has an area of 7.62 km². With 305,300 inhabitants (in 2002) it is one of Shanghai's most densely populated districts. The district borders the [[Huangpu District, Shanghai|Huangpu District]] in the east and south, [[Putuo District, Shanghai|Putuo District]] to the north and [[Changning District]] to the west. It is also home to one of Shanghai's business districts as can be seen in photos below. Jing'an District was named after [[Jing'an Temple]], an ancient traditional Chinese Buddhist temple, todays temple is a new replica of the old one, located in the southern part of the district. An Art Deco "dancehall" is just across the street; around the neighborhood are bar streets, although some areas develop and other close through the years. The Jing'an park, located oposite to the temple, is quite popular among locals; it used to be a graveyard for foreigners in the old Shanghai. {{Citation needed|date=December 2012}} ==Economy== Development in the Jing'an district has been rapid and continuous. In just three years the complete stock of Grade A Office Space has increased approximately 320 percent, from a total of just 333,000 sqm in 2007 to 1,067,000 sqm in 2010. West Nanjing Road is one of Shanghai's premier shopping districts, and is home to five-star hotels and exhibition centers as well as several upscale housing complexes.<ref>[http://www.knightfrank.com.cn Knight Frank China], Knight Frank China, Shanghai Research, Greater China Report 2009</ref> Key landmarks on West Nanjing Road include the [[Shanghai Exhibition Centre]] and the [[Shanghai Centre]]. Jing'an district is one of Shanghai's key central business and commercial districts. It contains numerous large office buildings, hotels, and many shopping venues at the street level. The district comprises a prominent portion of the Shanghai skyline. The district is also known for having many high-rise residential buildings.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://movingcities.org/movingmemos/shanghai-jingan-district-1/ |title=Shanghai Jing'An District |publisher=movingcities.org |date=January 20, 2010 }}</ref> {| class="wikitable" | [[File:Jingan1.jpg|x300px|A shot including the 3 tallest structures in Jing'An district]] |} {| class="wikitable" | [[File:Jingan2.jpg|x350px|Eastern part of Jing'An Skyline]] | [[File:Jingan3.jpg|x350px|Western part of Jing'An Skyline]] | [[File:Jingan4.jpg|x350px|Wheelock square and surrounding buildings]] |} ==Subdistricts== [[List of township-level divisions of Shanghai|Subdistricts]]: [[Jiangning Road Subdistrict]] (江宁路街道), [[Jing'ansi Subdistrict]] (静安寺街道), [[West Nanjing Road Subdistrict]] (南京西路街道), [[Caojiadu Subdistrict]] (曹家渡街道), [[Shimen Second Road Subdistrict]] (石门二路街道).<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.xzqh.org/html/list/412.html |title = 静安区-行政区划网 www.xzqh.org |publisher = XZQH |language = Simplified Chinese |accessdate = 2012-05-24}}</ref> ==References== {{More footnotes|date=October 2009}} {{reflist}} ==Further reading== * {{cite web |work=Encyclopedia of Shanghai |date=2010 |publisher=[[Shanghai Municipal Government]] |title= Jing'an District |url= http://zhuanti.shanghai.gov.cn/encyclopedia/en/Default2.aspx#170 }} ==External links== {{Portal|Shanghai}} {{Commons category}} *[http://www.jingan.gov.cn/ Jing'an District website] {{zh icon}} {{Shanghai}} {{coord|31.2314|N|121.453|E|source:kolossus-euwiki|display=title}} [[Category:Districts of Shanghai]]
